name: ambitiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows a wish to be successful, powerful, or rich: The team will have to play more ambitiously to win the tournament. Starting a new business requires you think intelligently and ambitiously.
in a way that needs great skill and effort to be successful or be achieved: I ambitiously embroidered a mountain scene on a jacket when I was only 13. The museum unveiled the ambitiously designed exhibit on Tuesday. See
ambitious
More examplesFewer examplesWith its new line of mobile devices, the company is looking ambitiously to the future.It is a creatively and ambitiously conceived plan. I think we need to start thinking a little bit more ambitiously.
